alert.note: Alert for Cooper (Missouri) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued June 01 at 8:14PM CDT until June 03 at 3:10AM CDT by NWS Kansas City
info.description: ...Observed flooding changed from Minor to Moderate severity and increased in duration for the following rivers in Missouri... Lamine River near Otterville affecting Cooper County. This product along with additional weather and stream information is available at www.weather.gov/kc/. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL EARLY FRIDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Moderate flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Lamine River near Otterville. * WHEN...Until early Friday morning. * IMPACTS...At 15.0 feet, Low lying woodlands and fields along the river flood. At 18.0 feet, Some gravel roads upstream and downstream from Otterville are under water. In addition State Highway 135 may be overtopped by flood waters 2 miles north of Clifton City. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 7:15 PM CDT Wednesday the stage was 18.8 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage late tonight and continue falling to 0.5 feet Monday evening. - Flood stage is 15.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood && Fld Obs Forecasts Location Stg Stg Day/Time Thu Thu Fri 1am 1pm 1am Lamine River Otterville 15.0 18.8 Wed 7pm 17.5 6.8 3.7 &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
